data.title: Good for a stroll
data.text: If you happen to be in downtown Lakeland and want to get your steps in, this is a great place to do just that. There are a variety of birds around the lake. I've seen weddings and photo-shoots happening here. I wouldn't make this your only reason to visit Lakeland, but if you're around and have time to spare, this is a great place to stroll.

data.title: Walk around.
data.text: Downtown Lakeland is beautiful.  Mirror lake is part of that beauty.  Nice flower gardens.  It has a great sidewalk around the whole lake.  Ducks and one Swan.  Good fishing as well.

data.title: A beautiful lake filled with interesting ducks, swans and even saw an eagle hunting!
data.text: Me and my friend loved seeing all of the ducks, geese and swans at Lake Mirror. There was entertainment and we even saw a bald eagle hunting in the lake. Another do not miss attraction in Lakeland, Florida. We enjoyed eating our lunch on the bench and watching the nature and wildlife!

data.title: Pretty and pleasant if you're in the area, not worth the trip from Kissimmee
data.text: I visited on a Sunday with my parents and toddler in a stroller. We had travelled to Lakeland to spend the afternoon here from Kissimmee for a walk and wonder in a nice setting. The lake is very pretty and the architecture and sculptures around it made for a very nice walk. It was weirdly quiet - hardly anyone about. The idea was for my toddler to nap in the buggy as we walked. She didn't and so wanted to walk with us. All of the route around the lake is buggy friendly, much of it was wide enough and safe enough for my toddler to walk and explore with us safely. The best bit about the lake was its proximity to Hollis Garden, Barnett Family Park and the downtown shops area. Worth a visit for a walk and some photos if you're in the area, but we much preferred the lakes in Kissimmee and Orlando. It wasn't worth the 45 minute drive.

data.title: Nice place to walk and relax
data.text: There was some loud festival going on around the lake that sort of took away from the ambiance.  However, this is a must see area if you come to Lakeland.  Lots of birds to see, especially a rare Mandarin duck!  Lots of places to sit and people watch. Just be aware if you have small kids that you can walk right off the edge of the walkway into the lake if you aren't careful!  Drive around and find 2 hour free street parking nearby and you are set!

data.title: Great location.
data.text: We like evening walks around the lake.  It is the location for a number of local events and is always a fun place to be.

data.title: Concours d'Elegance
data.text: Make the Concours show a definte stop. It is free to the public and has som,e stunning cars. It is superbly run and is easily viewed. It is set up around Lake Mirror. probably one of the best car shows in Florida.

data.title: Showing off our town!
data.text: Beautiful and well maintained the swans are typically close by to eat whatever you may drop.  We also like to gather apple snail shells. The shells are plentiful because the swans and ducks etc eat the snail out of it.

data.title: Nice place for a walk
data.text: This walkway, added to the National Registry of Historic Places in 1983, was in 1946 designated the Frances Langford Promenade in in honor of the work Lakeland native, singer and actress Frances Langford had done with the USO, and in music and acting. It's a lovely walk around the Lake that has other highlights including Hollis Gardens, Barnett Family Park, The Lake Mirror Center and the Volunteer Sculpture by Albert Paley. All of these spots are also excellent places to pick up Poke Balls for those playing Pokemon Go.

data.title: Attended a car show
data.text: We went to a car show at lake mirror and surrounding streets. Very quaint little area. Restaurants all around the area you can walk to. Very nice people. The lake is pretty. Gardens to view. Some resident ducks. Nice to walk around, or sit under the trees on the benches.

data.title: lovely little walk
data.text: We stayed at the Terrace Hotel after being evacuated from the coast.  It is right across from this lovely little park.  We enjoyed all the birds, the beautiful gardens and even the brewery that adjoin the walkway.  Definitely worth an hour or so if you are nearby.

data.title: Very nice
data.text: Very nice place. Nice walking areas there have concerts and other entertainment at certain times a year and for the July 4th big firework display

data.title: Beautiful & Romantic
data.text: After relocating to the Tampa Bay area, the hubs had a job interview in Lakeland so we decided to do some exploring and stumbled on this beautiful spot. The lake itself is gorgeous with lily pads and beautiful white swans & ducks.  There's a lovely garden with a hidden grotto which we thoroughly enjoyed snapping lots of pictures of and in. This is certainly a great spot for a stroll after dinner at one of the nearby restaurants in downtown. There's a restaurant on site as well, but we did not go inside. I can imagine this being a superb spot for an outdoor wedding as well. The huge lawn is perfect for an afternoon picnic and it appears there's an amphitheater for concerts or other shows, which we will be on the lookout for. Although our children are adults, I can see this being a great spot for families with children to enjoy a day in the Florida sunshine.

data.title: Historic Landmark Plus
data.text: The promenade that surrounds Lake Mirror is a beautiful venue for so many local activities from auto shows to symphony concerts to Swan Boat races.  Surrounding the lake are many amenities that add to the enjoyment:  Hollis Gardens, Barnett Park, Lake Mirror Center Theatre and Auditorium, You can find lunch , afternoon libation or dinner in or adjacent to the Park.  Have watched the development and improvement of the area for 30 plus years.  We really enjoy this gem in downtown Lakeland.

data.title: Beautiful and it is free!
data.text: The first time we visited Lake Mirror we were attending a concert.  The setting was beautiful and we were luck the weather was perfect.  This area is very tranquil and peaceful.  Finally, it is an excellent place to take a walk.

data.title: Great view
data.text: Wonderful place to take a stroll with significant other. There are a few friendly ducks and nicely lit for night stroll.  Park at garage after hours take a nice walk around lake you won't be dissatisfied.

data.title: Quaint..
data.text: I walked the lake in the morning while staying at nearby hotel. It is pretty, full of ducks, swans etc. Most are very very tame. On my tracker the lake was approx .75 around so I did 5 laps and met some of the same people each time and all were very friendly. There is a neat area with a coffee shop, wine bar etc just off the lake. I felt safe and enjoyed the area.

data.title: Charming lakeside walk
data.text:
Beautiful and elegant 
It's a nice walk around Lake Mirror. Has benches to rest  . 
It is very elegant and reminds me of Europe 
Parking is tricky look for street parking around the lake .

data.title: Beautiful lake with nice view of downtown area.
data.text: I have been down to this area several times for music events.  It is a nice area where you can bring you chair and cooler and sit down and listen to the music.  I most recently went for the fireworks display for 4th of July.  It was beautiful watching the fireworks going off over the lake.  The area has the lovely Hollis Gardens nearby as well as being located near the Texas Cattle Company restaurant.  Nice area, well maintained and a lovely place to walk around the lake.

data.title: Nice place to take a small walk.
data.text: When I have traveled on AMTRAK , I have enjoyed setting along this lake. A very nice addition to Lakeland.
